title: Ticket #7225: Allow ADVERTISE_* level authz to register with CCB, maybe others.
description:
Currently the ability to register with CCB is a "DAEMON" level operation. When using the new token-based auth, it is possible a startd may not have a full DAEMON-level but perhaps only an ADVERTISE_STARTD-level token.

It seems these should be sufficient to register with CCB in order to report to the collector. While changing this, consder whether any other levels (ADMINISTRATOR, NEGOTIATOR, CONFIG, WRITE) should be included as well. I think thge general ide is that daemoncore commands that "connect to other daemons from behind a firewall" should be able to register with CCB.

Milestone 1: Update this ticket with exact list of proposed changes to be made.

Milestone 2: Update CCB registration code accordingly.
